name: Thai Cha-Om Omelette Recipe (Acacia Leaves Egg)
description: This Thai cha-om omelette recipe is easy to make and absolutely delicious. Serve hot with a side of rice and a chili dip.

recipeInstructions.text: Mince your garlic and roughly chop the acacia leaves into 4–5 pieces.
recipeInstructions.name: Mince your garlic and roughly chop the acacia leaves into 4–5 pieces.

recipeInstructions.text: Crack the eggs into a large bowl, and toss in the chopped acacia, fish sauce, oyster sauce, and fresh lime juice. Thoroughly combine.
recipeInstructions.name: Crack the eggs into a large bowl, and toss in the chopped acacia, fish sauce, oyster sauce, and fresh lime juice. Thoroughly combine.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a non-stick pan over medium-low heat. Add minced garlic and sauté until golden and aromatic, or approx 20 seconds.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat oil in a non-stick pan over medium-low heat. Add minced garlic and sauté until golden and aromatic, or approx 20 seconds.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour your egg mixture into the pan, spreading the acacia leaves evenly. Let it cook for several minutes, until one side is cooked.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour your egg mixture into the pan, spreading the acacia leaves evenly. Let it cook for several minutes, until one side is cooked.

recipeInstructions.text: Carefully flip the omelet and cook the other side until done. Both sides should be perfectly cooked through. Serve hot off the pan.
recipeInstructions.name: Carefully flip the omelet and cook the other side until done. Both sides should be perfectly cooked through. Serve hot off the pan.

keywords: acacia leaves recipe, cha-om omelette, thai omelette
